intro: Scleria caricina, commonly known as the narrowleaf sedges, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and rushes. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, three-lobed flowers in spikelets. It typically grows in wet or moist environments such as marshes and stream banks. Scleria caricina is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to stabilize soil in wetland areas.
